problem_text:
An automorphism φ of a group G is called a nil-automorphism if, for every a ∈G, there exists n such that [a, nφ] = 1. Here [x, 1y] = [x, y] and [x, i+1y] = [[x, iy], y]. An automorphism φ is called an e-automorphism if, for any two φ-invariant subgroups A and B such that A ̸⊆B, there exists a ∈A \ B such that [a, φ] ∈B. Is every e-automorphism of a group a nil-automorphism?
V. G. Vilyatser
